description: Unique system-generated identifier for this part class record; used as the primary key for referencing and joins.
Business code for the part class, typically a short alphanumeric identifier used in UI and reports.
Human-readable name of the part class, describing the component category and, when applicable, vehicle/application specifics.
Flag indicating whether this part class is allowed to be used in bills of materials (1=yes, 0=no).
Flag indicating the part class represents fluids/consumables (e.g., oil, coolant) for inventory and handling rules (1=yes, 0=no; confirm with SME).
Free-text notes about the part class for internal documentation or special handling.
System timestamp for the most recent update to this record, regardless of source (user or process).
Timestamp of the most recent update performed by a user account; distinct from automated or system updates (likely; confirm with SME).
Identifier of the user who originally created the part class record.
Timestamp when the part class record was created.
Identifier of the user who last modified the record.
Timestamp when a user last modified the record.
